makerbit.connectInfrared: Connects to the IR receiver module at the specified pin.
makerbit.connectLcd:
Connects to the LCD at a given I2C address.
The addresses 39 (PCF8574) or 63 (PCF8574A) seem to be widely used.
makerbit.connectLcd|param|i2cAddress: I2C address of LCD in the range from 0 to 127, eg: 39
makerbit.getUltrasonicDistance:
Measures the distance and returns the result in a range from 1 to 300 centimeters or up to 118 inch.
The maximum value is returned to indicate when no object was detected.
makerbit.getUltrasonicDistance|param|ech: Pin connected to echo, eg: MakerBitPin.P8
makerbit.getUltrasonicDistance|param|tri: pin connected to trig, eg: MakerBitPin.P5
makerbit.irButton: Turns an IR button into its corresponding command code.
makerbit.irCommandCode: Returns the command code of the button that is currently pressed and 0 if no button is pressed.
makerbit.isIrButtonPressed: Returns true if a specific remote button is currently pressed. False otherwise.
makerbit.isLcdConnected: Returns true if a LCD is connected. False otherwise.
makerbit.level: Turns a digital pin level into a number.
makerbit.onIrButtonPressed: Do something when a specific button is pressed on the remote control.
makerbit.onIrButtonPressed|param|handler: body code to run when event is raised
makerbit.onIrButtonReleased: Do something when a specific button is released on the remote control.
makerbit.onIrButtonReleased|param|handle: body code to run when event is raised
makerbit.onIrCommandExpired: Do something when an IR command is expired.
makerbit.onIrCommandExpired|param|handle: body code to run when event is raised
makerbit.onIrCommandReceived: Do something when an IR command is received.
makerbit.onIrCommandReceived|param|handl: body code to run when event is raised
makerbit.position: Turns a LCD position into a number.
makerbit.setAnalogPin:
Sets an analog pin to a given level.
Configures this pin as an analog/pwm output, and change the output value to the given level
with the duty cycle proportional to the provided value.
The value is a number between 0 (0% duty cycle) and 1023 (100% duty).
makerbit.setAnalogPin|param|level: value in the range from 0 to 1023 eg: 1023
makerbit.setAnalogPin|param|name: name of the pin in the range from 0 to 20, eg: 5
makerbit.setDigitalPin:
Sets a digital pin to either on or off.
Configures this pin as a digital output (if necessary).
makerbit.setDigitalPin|param|name: name of the pin in the range from 0 to 20, eg: 5
makerbit.setLcdBacklight: Enables or disables the backlight of the LCD.
makerbit.setLcdBacklight|param|backlight: new state of backlight, eg: LcdBacklight.Off
makerbit.setLedPins:
Sets all LED pins to either on or off.
The pins 5 to 16 are MakerBit LED pins.
makerbit.showNumberOnLcd:
Displays a number on the LCD in the given position range.
If the number needs more space than the range provides, it will be cropped.
If there is space left, it will be filled with whitespaces.
makerbit.showNumberOnLcd|param|endPositi: the end position on the LCD, [0 - 31]
makerbit.showNumberOnLcd|param|startPosi: the start position on the LCD, [0 - 31]
makerbit.showStringOnLcd:
Displays a text on the LCD in the given position range.
The text will be cropped if it is longer than the provided range.
If there is space left, it will be filled with whitespaces.
makerbit.showStringOnLcd|param|endPositi: the end position on the LCD, [0 - 31]
makerbit.showStringOnLcd|param|startPosi: the start position on the LCD, [0 - 31]
